lead_paragraph: Before its official unveiling, the budget agreement is already threatened with irrelevance amid a bipartisan clamor for more spending in a new era of loosening belts.

headline.print_headline: Corker Stops Progress of Budget Deal, Even as Pressure for More Spending Builds
headline.main: Corker Stops Progress of Budget Deal, Even as Pressure for More Spending Builds

snippet: Before its official unveiling, the budget agreement is already threatened with irrelevance amid a bipartisan clamor for more spending in a new era of loosening belts.
abstract: Republican Sen Bob Corker of Tennessee single-handedly stops progress of House-Senate agreement that would deliver balanced budget, despite bipartisan clamor for more spending; refuses to sign agreement, citing what he calls a 'budget gimmick' that would allow for $190 billion in extra spending over 10-year period; Republican leaders call dispute temporary and express hopes for imminent final vote.
